isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 530 Engine Diagnostic Manual for 4000 Series Trucks (2001) - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS - CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - Change Oil Display

svcsubproc.title: Signal Functions

figure.caption: Function Diagram for Change Oil Message

svcsubproc.para: The Change Oil message will be displayed when a customer programmable service interval has been exceeded. These limits may be set for vehicle miles, hours, or calculated fuel consumption. These service interval limits may be adjusted or the Change Oil message feature may be turned on or off using the EST tool.

svcsubproc.title: Fault Detection / Management
svcsubproc.para: There is no fault detection for the Change Oil message feature.

note.para: After changing the engine oil, if the vehicle utilizes the Change Oil Message feature, reset the system as follows:

step1.para: Set parking brake (required for correct ESC signal).
Turn key switch to the IGN/ON position.
Depress and release both the Cruise On and Resume/Accel buttons simultaneously four times (4) times. This step 3 sequence must be performed within a six (6) second interval.
Depress and hold both the CRUISE ON and RESUME/ACCEL buttons simultaneously for three (3) seconds

note.para: The entire sequence MUST BE completed within twelve (12) seconds. The Change Oil Message will now turn off and will reactivate when the next oil change is due.

svcsubproc.title: Extended Description
svcsubproc.para: This group of parameters customizes the Service Interval feature. Service Interval allows the vehicle owner to customize when his vehicle requires servicing as in changing oil. When the programmed distance or engine hour has been reached, the Change Oil Message will be displayed to indicate its time for maintenance and service.

The limits listed below are the maximum and default values for the service internal function. Through the use of the EST tool these limits can be adjusted downward for specific customer needs, but not above the recommended factory service interval.

item.para: This parameter indicates to the on-board electronics if this vehicle has the service interval feature.
This parameter allows the customer to program the amount of fuel used since the last service before displaying the Change Oil Message.
This parameter allows the customer to program the amount of Engine Hours since the last service before displaying the Change Oil Message.
This parameter allows the customer to program the amount of Distance miles/kilometers since the last service before displaying the Change Oil Message.
This parameter indicates when the last service was performed.
This parameter indicates when the last service was performed.
This parameter indicates when the last service was performed.
This parameter indicates at what percentage of the service intervals should the Change Oil Message begin to flash as a warning.
This parameter indicates if the Change Oil Message is to be always ON after an engine start.
This parameter indicates how long to activate the Change Oil Message after an engine start if it is not always ON.
This parameter indicates to the on-board electronics if the vehicle has been serviced and the starting values are to be reset.
